Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: miucaptain
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice experience. Yes, the rooms are a bit small but the bed was comfortable and the shower worked great. The breakfast was so yummy. The staff is very helpful. Oh, and so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: JAC34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with a group of friends. The location couldn't be any closer to the main sites of the old town. You literally look over the Blue Mosque whilst having breakfast on the rooftop terrace. Of course, with any central location comes noise so bring some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper, but I quite like getting woken by the call to prayer. I had a double room to myself, which was great. The bed was very comfortable. However, I can see two people finding it small, especially if staying for several days, so you would have to stay organised. The bathroom is small and clean, with a great shower. It's only a small hotel, with perhaps 16 rooms in total, which means you do feel you are getting a very good personal service from the staff. They will even lend you a travelcard for the tram! The hotel has lovely decoration, is clean and is well maintained, but like any hotel it has wear and tear. The buffet breakfast was good and certainly set you up for the day. However, the food seems to be great everywhere in Istanbul. Overall, this is a great little hotel with lots of character and great staff. I judge it very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahPhilHoneymoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon in Turkey with three days at this hotel. The first night we wanted to stay they were full - so they put us up next door at a partner hotel - the Ambassador. (it was also great) The highlights of the Nomade were the views from the rooftop patio - delicious breakfast - and very pleasant and accommodating staff. Their in house travel agent, Serhat, helped us rent a car and plan our itinerary for the three weeks we had in Turkey. He speaks great English and is very friendly. At one point during our trip I forgot our passports at a hotel in southern Turkey but didn't realize until we had driven five hours north back toward Istanbul! We had the hotel send the passports to the Nomade Hotel and the Nomade Hotel was so understanding. They paid the shipping fee for us and kept the passports safe until we arrived a couple days later. The location simply cant be beat if you are wanting to hit up the main attractions in a small amount of time. It is literally a stones throw away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia - as well as the Basillica Cistern. It is a very short walk (five min) to the Grand Bazaar and the most popular Hammam in Sultanahmet. We found we were ticking things off our list quickly because of how conveniently located the Nomade hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: jacquiejune
Reviews.Content: My room on the first floor was small, which is ok, and quite noisy from the street (people and cafe noise), the maids closet..right across hall, and the weird bathroom vent which allowed me to hear my neighbors brush there teeth. So made use of my earplugs. Upstairs terrace is lovely...and the only place to get decent wifi. Desk staff were helpful and friendly. For the same money I thought the Ambassador Hotel next door had a much nicer room and a slightly better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: KBckMtz
Reviews.Content: location excellent! very nearby all the important site in istanbul. however if you are a very light sleeper you will not be able to sleep due to the noise from the street. the rooms were small but not THAT small and most importantly clean. breakfast is served on the terrace it was very yummy and the view is just spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great bar at the rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: dreveses
Reviews.Content: went there just for drinks. great view, quiet and cozy terrace to enjoy our drinks

Reviews.Title: “Great Bar with views”
Reviews.Author: gisUk
Reviews.Content: Even if you are not staying at this hotel we would recommend you visit the terrace bar. Sadat the barman is a great host who will give you all sorts of advice. The view over the Blue Mosque and down to the Bospherous are exceptional. it is very close to Sultanahmet tram stop. Go there and you will not be disapointed. You can also order in food.

Reviews.Title: “we had real problems”
Reviews.Author: nicholas g
Reviews.Content: Firstly they promised a transfer from airport. they never turned up . after waiting sometime , nearly an hour, they claimed that they had no vehicle booked. the transfer was inc in the room rate we had negotiated whilst in uk by email (all documents with us) or at least we believed we had negotiated that. We had to pay some 30GBP for a taxi. The rooms that we were shown were small and no especially nice . we complained and we moved to a bigger room. The drains smelt badly throughout our stay. there was no working hotel safe and we had leave our valuables at the desk. they offered no signed for receipt and i was not comfortable with this. We complained about the non transfer to the owner. he agreed to provide us with a transfer onwards to the airport when we left. When we had settled the bill on departure he went cold turkey and changed his mind leaving me with another bill of 50 euros for the cab to the further airport. I think not too trustworthy. breaks their word and I for one would not choose to stay here again. Pity as the location isn't bad. unusual for Turkey as you normally get what you sign up for!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dsdauphin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the mention of it in the NYT (link below) and could not have been more pleased. Yes, it is not inexpensive (eating in the Old City is cheap, but sleeping there will be your biggest expense), but the location simply could not be better. This hotel is on a leafy street only 1 block back from the tram line, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, and Hippodrome. If you walk along the tram line north for 5 minutes you will be at the entrance to the Grand Bazaar, follow it south for 5 minutes and you are at the entrance to Topkapi Palace and gardens. Take the tram down the hill (east) and you will be at the train and ferry terminals in 10 minutes. As you may know, the ferry terminals are where you will find the Bosphorus Cruise boats (e.g., Turyol cruises) and the vendors that sell fresh fish sandwiches directly from the boats. Across the tram line and street from the docks are the Yeni Camii/New Mosque, the Pet Market, and the Spice Market. As convenient as this sounds, a lot of hotels can boast the same if you stay around Sultanahmet Square, however Nomade offers an excellent boutique hotel experience with small but perfectly formed rooms on one of the most charming streets in this highly touristed area â€“ which is rare. See photos for what our room looked like. Outside our windows we could look down onto the street where 3-4 attractive restaurants had their outside seating. We ate at one of these (Cafe Adonin) and had an excellent if slightly overpriced meal. Some things to know: (1) If you are on the street facing side of the hotel, these restaurants can be loud and if you require absolute quiet, this means you will not be able to sleep with your windows open, although rooms have air conditioning. I think this is probably true for all the area hotels given how popular the district is with tourists and Turks alike. (2) The terrace is lovely, but the portion with the view has little-to-no shade so you will be sitting in direct sun to enjoy it. The view is so nice (see pics) that we did this each day, but very few of our fellow guests seemed to be willing to do the same. (3) It is probably best to tell your taxi driver Sultanahmet Square instead of the hotel name as the taxis we used did not know it. Print yourself a Google map before you leave home getting you from the Hippodrome in Sultahnamet Square to the hotel. Youâ€™ll only need to use this when you first get there and have no clue where things are, after that itâ€™s very easy. NYT reference: http://travel.nytimes.com/2007/04/22/travel/22istanbulweb.html

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: MC1526
Reviews.Content: The Nomade Hotel is an adorable boutique hotel in a very convenient location. The hotel is in easy walking distance of all the major tourist sites in Sultanahmet. I stayed in room 201, which was a very sunny room at the front of the hotel. I was traveling by myself but opted for the double room because it was much bigger and brighter. I had a cute view over Ticarethane street below and could even see one of the minarets of Aya Sofya from my room. The hotel has satellite TV in every room - there were channels from about every country in the world. The roof terrace is probably the highlight of the hotel - it has stunning, unobstructed views of Sultan Ahmet, Aya Sofya and the Marmara Sea beyond. An extensive breakfast is served on the terrace in the morning and the terrace is open in the afternoon and evening as a cafe. The only small drawback to the hotel was the small bathroom in the room. The bathroom had half doors that swung open - as a result you couldn't completely close the door to separate it from the rest of the room. If you were travelling with a friend I could see that set-up being a little awkward. Otherwise the hotel was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Spring break”
Reviews.Author: Active_Traveller014
Reviews.Content: Very well situated, close to Hagia Sofia & Blue Mosque just off tram route. Modern , slightly quirky. Very helpfull staff , Small rooms but well laid out . Super views from rooftop Breakfast & Bar area. Good breakfast with lots of variety. Does not do evening meals but restaurant directly opposite, owned by hotel was good value. They will arrange a pick up from the airport if you wish, more expensive than a taxi but as we were first time visitors we found that very helpful. I booked direct with the hotel via their website & got discount for cash payment on departure. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A small, friendly, family run hotel with charm and character.”
Reviews.Author: sparrow79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location very close to the Blue Mosque, shops, the Grand Bazzar and many diverse eating places. It is literally 30 yards from the tram transport system which connects you to the whole of Istanbul. The roof terrace bar has fantastic views over the Bospherous and a really friendly barman.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: turkeygirl8787
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff and rooms. Rooms can be a bit smaller but daily room service and breakfast makes it worth it. Plus an excellent, if not the best view, the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque on the quite roof top terrace bar. Great resturants and food markets near by, you really can not beat the location. This family run hotel has a friendly very helpful staff avaliable at all times, airport pickup included. Definitly will return!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: subitoo
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed at the Nomade. It has a PERFECT location--steps from the Blue Mosque in the heart of the Sultanhamet. The terrace views on the top floor are amazing!! Breakfast is served on the terrace and cocktails in the evening. AND if you want...you can order dinner from several of the nearby restaurants (also owned by the Nomade owners) and have it served on the terrace! The rooms are on the small side..and the bathrooms even smaller but spotlessly clean. We had one of the "larger" rooms for several nights and it was well worth the extra 20 Euros especially as the bathroom was larger. The manager, Bulent, is most helpful and responsive to one's needs. I am a tour director and when in Istanbul with groups--I stay at the Intercontinental. I MUCH prefer the charm, location, and coziness of the Nomade. And hope to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Meiwenti37
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Hotel Nomade and had a wonderful stay. The locatiion is superb for doing the historic sites, the staff are great, the room was modern and comfortable, and there is a lovely roof-top bar. There are hundreds of restuarents within a few minutes walk. If you are looking for a lovely, small romantic hotel with great staff this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad points to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillicentD
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay 4 nights in the hotel - 3 nights, leave for a few days and then the final night in Istanbul but they could only accommodate us for one night and then our final night. They booked us into the hotel next door for our first night (Ambassador). Our first night in the Hotel Nomade we had a nice bright room with good views over the rooftops. Negatives were that it was very small and the floor could do with a better cleaning. The bathroom was a tiny and lacked privacy - there were glass doors (saloon type) that didn't quite meet in the centre and only had partial frosting so if you like privacy in the bathroom I would not recommend the hotel! The terrace was lovely although we unfortunately had heavy rain on our stay so didn't use it often. Breakfasts were good and there was a lot of choice. The location is great and near lots of the sites but it is a noisy spot there at nighttime. The other problem we had was noise from the terrace - it seemed like early in the morning furniture was being dragged around directly over our heads. When we returned to Istanbul to the hotel, they had made a mess of our reservation so we were moved to to the Ambassador next door. We arranged transfers to the airport through the nomade and they were very prompt. The hotel has character but there is room for improvement. I would recommend it but with some reservations.

Reviews.Title: “I did not stay here but google maps...”
Reviews.Author: cill9112
Reviews.Content: i did not stay here but wanted to stay near this hotel as i had heard good reviews of the area. i typed into Google Maps it's location and it showed me that this hotel was on Ordu Cad, down past the Grand Bizaar which is not correct. Just a word of warning to not trust Google Maps on the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh.. the Breakfasts..”
Reviews.Author: mrpibby
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Getting to Istabul was a challenge, so once we finally arrived at the hotel ( after a couple of extra days in the Frankfurt Airport) we could not have been happier. Having only seen pictures via the internet, we were happy to arrive in a place with such friendly staff, clean rooms, a fabulous roof top terrace and in a perfect location. Every morning we awoke to breakfast in the cafe on the roof. The staff were so warm and the spread was incredible. We looked forward to our breakfasts.. some of the best eating we did. We were able to easily walk everywhere from the hotel. It was also close to the light rail ( part of the public transportation system) which dropped you off very close to the waterfront. The staff in the lobby spoke wonderful English and were always willing to offer suggestions about sites and gave us plenty of assistance with directions. If we ever return to Istanbul this will be where we stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the bustle of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Carpets72
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel and especially the terrace area with its view of the Haga Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Bospherous River. Very comfortable breakfast and lounging area, in particular at night. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The staff was professional but friendly. There is a "hotel" cat that leaps from roof to roof and is sometimes on the terrace. He did not deign to pay any attention or bother the tourists. The hotel has a real sense of place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: AymericB
Reviews.Content: ++ Good location at 1 min of sainte sophie and blue Mosq ---- Staff not friendly, children not welcomed, room in line with the price (small but clean) no wireless internet was working in the room

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, perfect location, friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Milady-London
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights during our stay in Istanbul. Our room on the 4th floor has a view over the blue mosque, Aya Sofia and the Bosphorus - room was light and clean - bed was perfect. All the staff was extremely helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Easy going and great location”
Reviews.Author: travelworm24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over a weekend here. The room was a generous size - the bathroom small but clean and had a WONDERFUL shower in it. The breakfast room is nice and the breakfast ok. The terrace also lovely with great views. The service for breakfast was a bit Fawlty Towers ... I am not sure the guy spoke any English and took ages to get a coffee. But we got one! Comfortable, reception staff were friendly (but always changing) and the place has a nice ambience. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is tops”
Reviews.Author: jojen_9
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for sight-seeing, smiling staff, basic rooms but well serviced daily and all queries were met with happy, patient responses. Close to all of the action of busy Sultanahment, a walk to the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace and a myriad of other Istanbul sites. Breakfast is served on the rooftop and you have gorgeous view of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. Of an evening, the breakfast room turns in a cute little bar - with impressive night views. We loved it and will definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: ny2istanbul
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Sultanahmet (near much of the tourist sights), there is no place better than Hotel Nomade. Sure, our room was small and our bathroom was tiny, but it was clean, sunny, and ideally situated. The front desk was helpful, the breakfast spread was delicious and the roof terrace had a great view. Keep in mind that it is noisy in the mornings when the mosques have their call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Nomade Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: funseeker2009
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel! It is on a cute side street in Sultanahmet district. It's extremely convenient to the major sights, the tram, and plenty of eateries and bars. The hotel itself is stylish and hip. The room was very comfortable. Breakfast is served up on the terrace, which has a lovely view of Bosphorous. Our favorite aspect of the hotel, however, was the friendly and helpful staff. With the reasonable rate we got, I think Nomade Hotel offers an incredible value. This place won't disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Sound Sleepers”
Reviews.Author: MisnamedRose
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two nights at the Hotel Nomade. The location, as everyone else has said, is unbeatable. But the tradeoff for that is the noise. The street noise goes late because of the restaurants across the street. (We slept well, though.) The lobby, stairs, and terrace have a lovely decor. Our room was small and minimally decorated. The mattress was iffy, but everything was clean. The bathroom was so small that it didn't have a real door -- just saloon-style frosted glass doors. Not a problem for us, but potentially awkward if you were there for a first romantic getaway with someone. Most of the staff was nice. They had messed up our reservation and although they seemed to want to do the right thing, they ended up needing to send us in a taxi to another hotel for the first night. The guy who was actually put us in the cab was rather rude when I suggested that we would actually go somewhere else. And then he didn't give the cab driver directions, so we ended up at the wrong hotel. Luckily, it all worked out in the end. There is a computer you can use to log onto the internet in the lobby. The connection was very slow, but it did work. The attendant mumbles something about having had trouble the last few days, so it may be that it's usually better. There is, in fact a lift. (Someone had said there wasn't.) But it's very small and it starts on the 2nd floor. So if you're inclined towards claustrophobia, you need to take the stairs. If you tend to get vertigo, you'll need to take the elevator -- the stairs are very twisty.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: mariellaScarlett
Reviews.Content: A truly little gem and we would recommend it to everyone intending to spend a few days in Istambul. The Nomade hotel is so well situated that we could walk everywhere without ever needing to get on buses. Also, we found the staff most friendly and helpful, (speaking English perfectly too!) . We were on the first floor so the views were not amazing but the room was very pleasantly decorated, modern, very clean, with TV, safe, private shower/loo, central heating ( which in March is welcome) and 3 large windows which let in lots of light! The breakfast was on the 5th floor, (where there is a lovely modern bar in the evening) and the food was spectacular and beautifully laid out. On the second morning it was warm enough to eat on the terrace with breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sofia and the Bosphorus... wonderful, well worth climbing all the way there!! ( as there is no lift). If we ever go back to Istambul, we will certainly return to the Nomade Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Hip place to stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: OnTheLoose65
Reviews.Content: My wife and a friend stayed here for four nights in March 2009 and had a simply wonderful time. Fortunately, we had none of the challenges of other reviewers of this hotel. Our two rooms were small but well laid out and decorated. Bathrooms were tiny but functional (and I loved the oversized 'rainbath' shower head). Most of all, our room and bath were very clean and maintained daily. Best of all, we absolutely lived in the ultra-hip, casual rooftop lounge/bar/patio/restaurant. Ihan and his crew were great bartenders and served 'room service' meals to us in the lounge from the hotel-owned Mozaic restaurant across the street. Did I mention that the patio features stunning views of both the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque? I can think of no better place to hang out with a glass of wine, listening to the exotic call to prayer from the surrounding minarets. As professional (early) 40-somethings who enjoy travel, good food, atmosphere and local experiences, we could have stayed at the Four Seasons or any number of boutique hotels in town. For the price we're paying here at Nomade, I'd call this place a quality deal. To that end, we'll be back at the end of the month as a close to our visit to Turkey. I can't think of a better place to listen to the

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Ghettolunchbox
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fablulous. Right near all the main attractions and great resturants. The bathrooms are outstandingly small. The rooms are okay for sleeping the double bed room is basically one bed that is seperated in half by an inch so if you don't mind sleeping basically in the same bed as the person you are traveling with then it's okay. The breakfast is great with a nice view. I would not reccomend traveling during the winter it is rainy and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooftop view at Nomade”
Reviews.Author: ychatav
Reviews.Content: The rooftop restaurant/bar was where we spent a considerable amount of time enjoying an incredible view of the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. The bartender was welcoming and brought us treats (e.g., mint lemonade, salted cucumbers) as we enjoyed the view. The rooms are somewhat small, but comfortable. The hotel is excellently situated for easy sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ZurichTraveller71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location to explore Sultanahmet. It has a lovely rooftop bar where they serve breakfast and evening drinks with great views of the Blue Mosque and the surrounding area. The hotel staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants, places to see, ordering taxis etc. It's not the swankiest hotel in Istanbul but it's good value for money and there's so much to do in Istanbul you won't be sitting in your room for long.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the financial part of the deal !”
Reviews.Author: wintertime61
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, but sadly when paying the bill they insisted that a free offered service wasn't free at all. I payed and at home mailed the proof that I payed too much. Nomade promised to repay but never did. I'm sad to say you can't trust this hotel when it comes to money ! The rooms are advertised a lot better then the reality was. Clean but some bad finishing and small ! The fire escape route is situated on a window of a room that's rented to another person. You have to be lucky the people are in if there is any trouble for their roomdoor is locked or you have to jump from your window three stores below !!! The good: nice centered in Istanbul and good breakfast. Great view from the terras. The bad: not thrustworthy, no good fire escape in an old building surrounded by restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CeilidhVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hotel Nomade and we were very satisfied with our stay there. The location is perfect for sightseeing as you are within easy walking distance of the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. There are lots of restaurants nearby so basically all of your needs are just steps away. The hotel has a wonderful roof terrace with great views of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. It's a great spot to enjoy your breakfast and an evening drink after a long day of sightseeing. The common areas of the hotel are very stylishly decorated but could perhaps do with a fresh coat of paint here and there. There is a small elevator however you still need to navigate a narrow winding staircase to get to the terrace and again to street level so travellers who have difficulty with stairs may want to take this into consideration before choosing this hotel. We stayed in Room 404 and found it to be very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was on the small side, but the shower worked great and the hot water and towels were plentiful. Our room was right next to the elevator and staircase and although we did not find it a problem, lighter sleepers may find the noise from these disturbing at times. Our only problem with the room was the floorboards outside the bathroom which felt in need of some reinforcing supports (a little too springy for comfort). This was a bit unnerving at times. We found the staff to be very pleasant and very professional. They arranged for very efficient transfers from/to the airport (including a very early morning transfer) for a reasonable fee. We appreciated having this service available to us. Overall, we would recommend this stylish little hotel to others. The Hotel Nomade delivers a comfortable room, in a great location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location/clean and good fun”
Reviews.Author: LukeandMarie
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the nomade and given its location, the transfers to and from the airport and the proximity ot the Grand Bazaar (the mosques are great but the shopping is better) we highly recommend it. Also, the staff was very friendly and most evening we would end up on the roof terrace (inside - as outside was still too cold) drinking and smoking until all hours with some of the staff. the rooms are very good by european standards, but if someone is expecting the Hilton ot the four seasons this is not it, and neither should it be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MSTAR83
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this hotel! The location was great! Not only were you were directly across the street from the Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque but you were within walking distance from most major tourist sites. The rooftop balcony provided great views and the staff were very friendly. The rooms were really cute and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit the gorgeous city of Istanbul and who is on a moderate budget.

Reviews.Title: “OK but the staff smoking in the lobby wasn't very appealing”
Reviews.Author: Spumone
Reviews.Content: The staff were very nice and the hotel was OK in my books. The best part was that it is centrally located to all major sites and near the tram but it is a very noisy hotel and I really had trouble sleeping the whole 4 nights I was there. The rooms are nice but the bathrooms are inpossibly small. It would be very difficult to share this sized room with another person. Also the staff smoked in the lobby on night shift and then would spray the floral spray to cover it up and I found that bothersome. If I am paying, I don't want to be exposed to smoke at all. Probably wouldn't stay again. Again the staff were very nice and helpful though!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nottinghampaul
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews I booked the Nomade for a five night stay with my wife. The taxi collected us as arranged at Sabiha Gokcen airport. I too stayed in room 403, as did the previous reviewer. My opinion is a little different. The room is very small and tired looking. The bed was comfortable. The "bathroom" is small beyond belief and there is black mould in the shower. Because of the large glass shelf over the sink, shaving was very difficult. Washing of any sort was tricky. Breakfast was fine and the roof terrace gave spectacular views over the city. We used the hotel owned restaurant across the road once only and found it rather expensive for a very average meal. By far the best thing about the hotel is the location, within walking distance of many of the main sights. In summary, it was OK but no more and I am reluctant to recommend it despite the superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I had in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Hamurabi
Reviews.Content: I spent almost a month traveling throughout Turkey and this was the best place I stayed in. The location simply can't be beat, this is the most perfect spot in all of Sultanahmet. I very much enjoyed the very friendly staff, the very generous and delicious breakfast every morning, and the cozy room I had, room #403 on the 4th floor. On the downside, the walls are thin and you do hear people walking up the staircase from time to time, but I didn't have any problems with it. My room was cleaned every morning and everything worked fine (the A/C and TV were perfect). Yes the rooms are a tight squeeze and so is the bathroom, but this is very common for Istanbul (or even say NYC or London). The people who complain about this place have no idea how much worse off it could be. All my other hotels in Turkey were disasterous by comparison to this place. And do pay in cash, they will take 10% off your bill if you do so. I will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Hotel Nomade”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTerri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from Istanbul yesterday and were very disappointed with our stay at Hotel Nomade both at the start and end of the trip. The roof top terrace is a wonderful retreat and the view is spell-binding. The terrace is a great spot to enjoy the very good breakfast or wind down from a busy day. The rooms however, are very small and are showing their wear as the paint is damaged, walls are bruised, and baseboards are coming off. The bathrooms are tiny and have no ventilation system. Consequently, the showers are mouldy. The bathroom door in room 103 opens just 15 inches and one needs to slink into the bathroom to avoid hitting one's head. We found hotel staff to be indifferent although helpful when pressed. Location is wonderful and the terrace is great but we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel, some issues”
Reviews.Author: girasol2000
Reviews.Content: Overall: This is a charming boutique hotel, but make sure you are not on the top floor and verify that you will have a working Air Conditioner. Postives: Great location right next to the Blue Mosque and the other sites in Sultanamet Helpful front desk Scenic restaurant on top Soft sheets compared to sheets from hotels on the coast. Looked like there was high tech TV (I didn't try to watch it) Great bathroom. Negatives: Our A/C didn't work, so they ended up discounting our rooms a bit. We were on the floor just below the restaurant, so there was a lot of noise in the morning and night from the cooking and the workers. The room smelled a bit musty. The restaurant was pretty, but the service was so slow we left and went to a different restaurant. They could also clean the cushions a bit more.

HotelInfo.Name: Nomade Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Divanyolu Caddesi, 15 Ticarethane Sokak | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
